content: the cuff the yarns will start off in the correct place so there s no slipping of stitches needed you ll do the same setup for each row as you did for the cuff and when you reach the end of a colour block you ll do an intarsia twist and leave the old yarns there work the full chart row 1 through 21 once then repeat row 4 through 21 repeat once more row 4 through 12 for a total of 48 row heel flap refer to the heel flap chart for this section this pattern uses a standard heel flap the heel uses only two of the colour groups if you want a specific colour to not appear in the heel you can slip stitches around your needles to make that colour the third one used in the row the heel flap will begin the same as row 13 of the leg chart but the row won t be finished until after the heel is complete for the first row slip a pair of stitches with yarns between layers knit/purl 4 pairs and then place a marker follow the heel flap chart to the end of the first row and then place a second marker for the rest of the heel the colour change will stay in the same place and you ll be working between the two stitch markers turn to start row 2 for the rest of the heel flap you ll slip the first pair of each row and also the last pair of the first intarsia block both slipped pairs will be in the same colour block for just the slipped pairs at the start of the row slip the front-layer
